intro: Spergularia angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, elongated leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Spergularia angustata plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
